metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8660 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
The ovl_setattr function in fs/overlayfs/inode.c in the Linux kernelthrough 4.3.3 attempts to merge distinct setattr operations, which allowslocal users to bypass intended access restrictions and modify theattributes of arbitrary overlay files via a crafted application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-6.17
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.3.0-6.17
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.3.0-6.17
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0-6.17').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.4').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
